title: add code to make mxnet do conv as caffe
body:
This is to fix #2997 : Under CPU model, convert Caffe model to MXNET using convert tool failed 
added code to processing the calculating the boundary in same way as caffe
This feature is turn off by default in config.mk and cmake file. 
To make mxnet do conv is the same way as caffe:
change 
CAFFE_CONV_COMPATIABLE = 0 
to 
CAFFE_CONV_COMPATIABLE = 1

If will fix the error reported during model convert and make the converted caffe model run correctly under mxnet.

I am working on using the experimental GPU codegen for Julia (https://github.com/JuliaGPU/julia & https://github.com/JuliaGPU/CUDAnative) to create kernels for MXNet.
For that purpose I need to insert the CuModule directly and thus bypass NVRTC.

title: Dockerfile for building and previewing docs locally.
body: Fully documented instructions for building the entire documentation (including API reference) without relying on any external tools like readthedocs.org.  Dockerfile to run the docs build in a container so that all dependencies are explicitly modeled.  This will give people a reliable way to preview any docs changes they make with negligible setup and without needing explanation from anybody who knows how it's supposed to work.  Also instructions for fast iterative documentation development.

title: Add BatchNorm support in lstm bucketing example

I make some breaking changes in mxnet/python and c++ module:
1.Add BatchNorm to lstm.
2.Add layer normalization to BatchNorm.
3.Expose parameter names and auxiliary state names to python.
And some other changes for supporting BatchNorm in lstm.
Is it good for allowing duplicate argument names and auxiliary state names in a model?(Any variables with same names will share ndarrays?)
Pull request need your help.

title: [REFACTOR] Move TBlob and TShape to mxnet
body:
This PR moves TBlob and TShape directly to mxnet. 

The reason of the change was that TBlob does not usually carries computations and having it in mxnet can make the data structure more clear for the users, and helps us on future re-factoring to isolate the components.

Tested this change on ubuntu

repo.name: mxnet
repo.description: Lightweight, Portable, Flexible Distributed/Mobile Deep Learning with Dynamic, Mutation-aware Dataflow Dep Scheduler; for Python, R, Julia, Scala, Go, Javascript and more

title: CSS for docs: removing inherit for font properties on most elements.
body:
The current python API reference docs look like a giant wall of text because there's no font difference between the argument names and descriptions.  Removing these CSS overrides allows the browser default CSS rules for <strong> (bold-faced) and <em> (italics) to remain, making the API reference much easier to read.

Also, updating README: building docs needs mock==1.0.1.  Latest version of mock (2.0.0) fails.

title: [OP] Generalize SoftmaxActivation
body:
1. The forward pass for SoftmaxActivation was limiting the inputs to rank-4 tensors. This restriction didn't exist in the backward pass nor for the cudnn implementation of the forward pass. This restriction is now lifted. 
2. Fixed small mistake in the docs for this symbol (used 'type' rather than 'mode' in the description).

title: Add several optimizer in R
body:
Add `Adam`, `AdaGrad`, `AdaDelta` optimizer in R and test them in [mnist classification](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/example/image-classification). Part of the test results are below.
- `Adam` optimizer with parameters `learning.rate=0.001`, `optimizer="adam"`


repo.name: mxnet
repo.description: Lightweight, Portable, Flexible Distributed/Mobile Deep Learning with Dynamic, Mutation-aware Dataflow Dep Scheduler; for Python, R, Julia, Scala, Go, Javascript and more

title: [Op] cuDNN RNN Symbol
body:
This adds an interface to the cuDNN RNN operator. Some issues:
1. The forward pass in inference mode reproduces https://github.com/soumith/cudnn.torch
2. The backward mode is currently not working, due to incorrect handling of dropout descriptor. Correct handling of the dropout state needs to be added.
3. It doesn't currently inherit the MXNet seed for dropout. How is this seed accessed?
4. This symbol currently only supports data in form [seq length, batch, input size], which is the native cuDNN format. Should add support for [batch, seq, input] as well, but will probably require a temp state + transpose.
5. Gives an option to return multiple outputs (output + 2 states for LSTM, 1 for others). By default only a single output is returned, but sometimes you require access to the output states (eg generating text).
6. Currently only support the CUDNN_LINEAR_INPUT option for cudnnRNNInputMode_t.
7. Uses a single parameter vector. It will be useful to have a Python script to convert this to a dictionary of NDArray's giving each weight + bias for each layer.

See also: #2401

repo.name: mxnet
repo.description: Lightweight, Portable, Flexible Distributed/Mobile Deep Learning with Dynamic, Mutation-aware Dataflow Dep Scheduler; for Python, R, Julia, Scala, Go, Javascript and more

title: extend Module to fix_param_names that saves gradient computation and update faster rcnn example
body:
set_lr_mult and set_wd_mult are good choice for fine-tuning networks on other vision tasks. However gradients would be calculated even if weights were not to be updated. Adding `fix_param_names` to Module and DataParallelExecutorGroup will enable the binding process of executors to recognize trainable parameters.

Faster R-CNN demo is updated accordingly. More details will be finalized after the fix of cudnn auto tuning problem.

title: update rcnn example to Faster R-CNN
body:
Due to Commit 0ad34c9bada6eb3a5e11c8b56b7e36ddaa214bfd cudnn auto tuning, training speed has been decreased to 0.3 samples/sec, with 5+ samples/sec as the usual case. For this reason, we have not proceeded our attempts at finalizing details on the new Module API, nor added "fix_param_names" and set grad_req to null to Module.
To run this example, prepare data according to this outdated README and use `python -m tools.train_rpn` and `python -m tools.train_rcnn`.

title: Infershape fix
body:
Fix Infershape in pooling comparing unsigned type with zero. However the problems in #2718 and #2709 are not fixed. The stride was removed in the numerator in latest commit. I can revert it back to previous version, so some old network setup get working. But I need to know if we should do so and reasons for not to do it. 

@antinucleon @sxjscience @tqchen

title: Add RMSProp optimizer in R
body:
Add RMSProp optimizer in R and test it  in [mnist classification](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/tree/master/example/image-classification) with parameters `learning.rate=0.002`, `optimizer="rmsprop"`. Part of the test result is:

```
Batch [50] Train-accuracy=0.1125
Batch [100] Train-accuracy=0.335234375
...
Batch [450] Train-accuracy=0.783871527777778
[1] Train-accuracy=0.789848768736617
[1] Validation-accuracy=0.939102564102564
Batch [50] Train-accuracy=0.95375
...
[3] Train-accuracy=0.970302483974359
[3] Validation-accuracy=0.965845352564103
Batch [50] Train-accuracy=0.97203125                                                                                                                                                              [462/523]
...
[5] Train-accuracy=0.979767628205128
[5] Validation-accuracy=0.96875
...
[9] Train-accuracy=0.985259748931624
[9] Validation-accuracy=0.977664262820513
...
[10] Train-accuracy=0.986328125
[10] Validation-accuracy=0.975460737179487
```

title: Add Img2vector tools
body:
Img2Vector tools could convert imgae directory into Vectorized RDD，for example：
Images stored in hdfs://namenode:9000/user/xxx/images/
scala> import ml.dmlc.mxnet.spark.utils.Img2Vector
scala> val sc = new SparkContext(conf)
scala> val imagesRDD = Img2Vector.getRGBArray(sc, "hdfs://namenode:9000/user/xxx/images/")

title: add RepIterator
body:
add Repeatable Iterator useful in mapPartitions like：
scala> val data = sc.parallelize(1 to 3)
scala> def func[T](iter:Iterator[Int]): Iterator[Int] = {val repiter = new RepIterator(iter, 2);repiter.map(x => x)}
scala> data.collect.foreach(println)
1
2
3
scala> data.mapPartitions(func).collect.foreach(println)
1
2
3
1
2
3

title: Fix bug of image resize in im2rec.py
body:
The tool `im2rec.py` seems wrong in resizing images.
The `cv2.resize(img, newsize)` function resizes an image with `newsize=(cols, rows)`, where `cols=img.shape[1]` and `rows=img.shape[0]`.

title: PS node recovery support
body:
- When a worker node died and restarts, it can join the cluster again. This PR https://github.com/dmlc/ps-lite/pull/59 need to be merged first
-  Timeout for ps scheduler and servers for _Spark_. PS scheduler and servers are started in a spawned process. But when something goes wrong, e.g., workers, servers or the scheduler crash, they will have no chance to stop themselves. I think the simplest way to solve this problem is to set a timeout T, if the scheduler/server does not receive any message in T seconds, stop itself.

Related to https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/2268

title: Warpctc mult label length
body:
Previous warpctc integration only support fixed label length. Now support multi length.

Method is simple.

If you label length is between [a, b], then, in dataiter, you should provide label data with length b, and if label length is smaller than b, you should append 0 after label to make is have length b.

Here, 0 is reserved as blank.
